meanings.definition: A type of protein found in bacterial flagella.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the flagellins under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The flagellins help bacteria move around in liquids.
meanings.sent3: The flagellins in the bacteria's tail were having a race.
meanings.sent4: The flagellins danced together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: Under the lens, the flagellins shimmered like tiny jewels.

meanings.definition: Proteins that make up the whip-like structure of a flagellum.
meanings.sent1: The flagellins form the long tail of the bacteria.
meanings.sent2: When the flagellins rotate, the bacteria can swim.
meanings.sent3: The flagellins in the flagellum were practicing their synchronized swimming routine.
meanings.sent4: The flagellins cracked like a whip as the bacteria propelled forward.
meanings.sent5: The flagellins swirled around like a tornado, propelling the bacteria forward.
